Describe yourself with a long text
I offer you assistance for any problems related to the electrical plant of your house. I only work in zones near to me (no further away than 50 miles). Good reviews available.
More button for opening the edit menu
There are no specific services, try "All"...
Welcome to TimeBanking! Please insert your details to complete your profile.
Welcome to TimeBanking! Before starting, please fill the following form to complete the registration phase!
Please leave a feedback on the service you received with a vote between one and five stars. You can also leave a public anonymous comment.
There\'s nothing here, come on: make the first move, you won\'t regret!
This user has not received any reviews yet.
Your service has terminated! Please, rate your service and leave a comment
One or more of your timeslots are no more available! Update your advertisement date, and other users will see what you can offer.
Reviews by people who borrowed my time:
Reviews by people whose time I borrowed:
What is the concept behind the time-based currency?

In economics, a time-based currency is an alternative currency or exchange system where the unit of account is the person-hour or some other time unit. In our system, everyone\'s contributions have the same value: one hour equals four credits. Then, one person volunteers to work for an hour for another person; thus, they are credited with one hour, thus four credits, which they can redeem for some time of service from another volunteer.
How can I offer a timeslot?

When you want to offer a timeslot, you just need to click the \"+\" button in the main page in order to fill a form and publish your offered timeslot. All the users will be able to see it and to start a chat with you in order to contract. Don\'t worry: you\'ll be able to edit your offered timeslot just clicking on it and selecting the \"pencil button\".
I\'ve started a chat: now, how can I generate a proposal for the other user?

Just clicking on the \"+\" button above the message input field: in this way, a pre-compiled form will be showed and you\'ll be able to generate a proposal which can be then accepted or rejected by the other user.
How can I filter between all the available timeslots?

There are several ways to filter the timeslots. You can select \"All services\" from the drawer menu to see the different skill categories. Otherwise, from the main page, you can click on \"Filter\" to select timeslots based on location, date and duration to best suit your needs. Then, you can sort the timeslots based on different criteria.
Can I edit comments and rating on my profile?
No, you cannot. All your received comments and ratings are visible to other users.
How can I offer a proposal to ask for a service?

Once you opened the chat with another user, a button will appear over the input field: by clicking on it, you will be able to present a proposal to them. In the proposal, you will select a location, a starting time and a desired duration: if you have enough credit for the selected duration and the offering user accepts your conditions, the transaction is completed.
What is the state of a timeslot?

A timeslot goes through several phases:

- Available timeslot: it is the base state of a timeslot once it is created. It consists of a set of information: title, description, associated skills, restrictions, expected service duration, date and starting/ending time of availability (time range within which the server is available to provide the service). It will appear in the list of timeslots (home screen) once selected a specific service.
- Active timeslot: it is the state corresponding to an activated service (i.e. when the advertisement owner and a client agreed on activating it). It will appear in the Active tab and will show information related to the trading between server and client (actual location, actual starting time, actual duration) when the activation period expires, the service must be rated and a button will appear to do it.
- Ended timeslot: when an active timeslot is rated by both client and server, it becomes ended.
- Expired timeslot: it is the state of a timeslot which has not been activated and whose ending time of availability has expired.
